page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content:
between the hills of the Forest of Bowland and Longridge Fell, and is well watered by several streams, the River Loud crossing the south-eastern part of the district before joining the River Hodder.
{LANDSCAPE
Most of the old part of the village which is the centre of a conservation area, dates from the seventeenth century. The new part of the village consists of two small estates of houses built by the Ribble Valley District Council. There first of these was built after the Second World War, and the other one about ten years ago.
Between these two parts of the Village is the Green which is over-looked by the Parish Church of St. Bartholomew {
